alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 3:16PM PDT until further notice by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nevada, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 300 PM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 309 PM PDT, Automated stream gauge reports indicate higher flows from snowmelt and releases from Eagle Valley Reservoir. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include...Ursine, Eagle Valley and Rose Valley Road between Ursine and Echo Canyon State Park, Delmue Ranch Road in Dry Valley, Rainbow Canyon. State Route 322 and 317 remain closed due to flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
